column4: I have Breezy and am trying to view streaming videos in WMV or Realaudio. I have Mplayer and Realplayer installed, stil it does not work. Where can I find solutions?
have you used the Ubuntu wiki's RestrictedFormats info/
no
will do that
for desktop publishing? Scribus is great
there's an animation plugin for the GIMP - search Synaptic for it, I can't remember what it's called
ok
gimp-gap
np
what're you trying to install?
look at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9741
as you can see it will remove like everything
-f in the install line can do messy things - what are you trying to do, again?]
am trying to get rid of unmet dependencies
can you pastebin your sources.list for us?
the only folks I've seen with odd apt-get results like yours had badly messed up sources.list files...
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9742
try this sources.list, yours looks odd: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6666
your install working now?
it was ubuntu-desktop that was giving me problems
on thing left to solve. The machine wants to delete the kernel image I'm running, odd huh?
fun... run apt-get update and see if there's something newer it wants to use instead?
nope, nothing to update
you can mount it to, say, ~/Documents (or any other directory inside your home dir.
